meanings.definition: A harsh, grating sound made by rubbing together dry surfaces.
meanings.sent1: The scroop of the old door hinges echoed through the house.
meanings.sent2: I heard a scroop as I dragged the chair across the wooden floor.
meanings.sent3: The scroop of the chalk on the blackboard made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent4: The scroop of the car brakes sounded like a banshee wail.
meanings.sent5: The scroop of the rusty gate was a symphony of unpleasantness.

meanings.definition: To make a harsh, grating sound.
meanings.sent1: The branches scroop against the window during the storm.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally scrooped the fork across the ceramic plate.
meanings.sent3: The cat scrooped its claws on the scratching post.
meanings.sent4: The old swing scrooped as it moved back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The wheels of the cart scrooped loudly as it rolled down the hill.

meanings.sent1: The scroop of the leaves in the wind was soothing.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the scroop of the curtains as they moved in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The scroop of the silk dress made her feel elegant.
meanings.sent4: The scroop of the broom on the floor signaled the start of cleaning.
meanings.sent5: The scroop of the pages turning was the only sound in the library.
